results.title: Visit to the Tulip Farm
results.creator_credit: John Barnett and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. John recounts the highlights of visiting a tulip farm in Silvan and other places.

results.title: Visit to Picasso = Visite a Picasso
results.creator_credit: Art et Cinema, Paul Haesaerts and Jean Van Raemdonck
results.brief_description: A study of the work of Picasso showing the development of his technique from his ‘blue’ period, through Cubism to abstraction. A series of paintings, sculptures and ceramics in the first part of the film lead to a personal interview with the artist in his studio at Vallauris in which he gives an unusual demonstration of his technique by sketching white paint on an invisible sheet of glass placed between himself and the camera. Examples of the artist’s work in the film are from the Musee d’Antibes at Vallauris which is devoted almost entirely to the exhibition of Picasso’s work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art et Cinema, Paul Haesaerts and Jean Van Raemdonck

results.title: Visit to an airport
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description: Two children visit an airport and learn about various aspects of its operation; luggage checks, plane checks, take-off procedures, control tower operations, food preparation and movement of food into the planes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gibson Film Productions, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay

results.title: Visit to a dairy farm
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description:
Two children visit a dairy farm and learn about the way of life there. Shows the bringing in of the cows for milking, the operation of the milking pumps, the provision of milk for calves, the milk trucks which take the milk from farm to factory and the by-products obtained from milk.
Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Visit to a container port
results.creator_credit: Gibson Film Productions, Dave Gibson and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description:
Two children visit a container port and learn about its functions and operations. Shows the loading and cleaning of the containers, the ship’s control rooms and the ship’s engine rooms.
Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Visit from Africa
results.creator_credit: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Documents the visit of two South Africans to Cree tribes in Northern Quebec, Canada, showing how indigenous people forge links to make a better future for themselves by discussing relevant issues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions

results.title: Visions of Victoria
results.creator_credit: Janne Martin Video Productions and Stewart Faichney
results.brief_description:
On a continent distinguished for its unique mixture of climates and for its exotic wildlife, there is no state that provides more variety and contrast than Victoria. Occupying the south-east corner of Australia, and only slightly larger than the size of Great Britain, Victoria has something for everybody. This video takes you on a remarkable tour of the state of Victoria which includes the wilderness areas of its world famous national parks, some of the best surf beaches in the world, Australia’s largest inland lagoon system, a rugged shipwrecked coast, winter resorts and high country, wetlands and even deserts. Also the vibrant and sophisticated city of Melbourne, renowned for its beautiful parks and gardens, exciting restaurants and nightlife, its devotion to the arts and, of course, a fanatical love of sports of all kinds. This superb video is a comprehensive celebration of this wonderful state, in all its beauty, seasons and moods.

Note: the end has a segment on film classification showing Bill Collins introducing the “G” rating.

results.title: Visions of perfection
results.creator_credit: Prahran School Support Centre, TV Ed Productions and Diane Charleson
results.brief_description: The Victoria College of the Arts provides a venue for talented children in the performing arts of music and dance to combine these with their academic studies in a high school setting. A student violinist, percussionist, ballet dancer and pianist talk about the courses available and demonstrate some of the activities in the school.
